Introduction¶

The Robust optimization of Hydrogen systEms In renewable Applications (RHEIA) framework provides a robust optimization and uncertainty quantification tool for hydrogen-based energy systems and external system models. A brief overview on the features of RHEIA is provided in lab:functionalities, followed by a detailed illustration on how to connect your own model (Python based, open source or closed source) in lab:connectingyourownmodel. If these features comply with your need, the installation procedure and package dependencies are illustrated in installationlabel. As a first step, the lab:tutorial provides an initiation of using the framework on a hydrogen-based energy system. Additional examples are illustrated in lab:examples. The models are characterized by a design space, which defines the design variables, and a stochastic space when parameter uncertainty is considered. Those spaces are defined in two files, which are elaborated in lab:stochasticdesignspace. The guides to perform the deterministic optimization, robust optimization and uncertainty quantification are present in lab:optimization and lab:uncertaintyquantification, respectively. A first post-processing of the results can be performed following the steps detailed in lab:postprocessing, such as plotting the fitness values after an optimization or reading the significant Sobol’ indices after uncertainty quantification. The applied methods and energy system models are described in lab:methods and lab:energysystemmodels, respectively. The documentation concludes with the lab:APIref and the details on how to contribute to the framework (lab:contribution).

Support¶

Contact us rheia.framework@gmail.com
